body:
Trying to install py-matplotlib via spack for python 2.7.13 with ucs4 (don't know if the latter will be important, but it lead to some headaches already)

The following scenario leads to the failure:
```
spack install py-matplotlib@2.0.0 +animation +ipython +latex +qt ^python+ucs4
```
after fixing the texlive md5 (is there a way to say -n only for texlive?) the installation goes through but now doing the following:
```
spack load -r py-matplotlib@2.0.0
ipython
import Python 2.7.13 (default, Feb  1 2017, 17:14:18) 
Type "copyright", "credits" or "license" for more information.

IPython 5.1.0 -- An enhanced Interactive Python.
?         -> Introduction and overview of IPython's features.
%quickref -> Quick reference.
help      -> Python's own help system.
object?   -> Details about 'object', use 'object??' for extra details.

In [1]: import matplotlib

In [2]: matplotlib.use('Agg')

In [3]: import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

In [4]: plt.figure()
Illegal instruction
```

After some googleing I found the following:
```
gdb --args python -c 'import matplotlib.pyplot as plt; plt.figure()'
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/wang/environment/software/jessie/spack/2017-01-26/opt/spack/linux-debian8-x86_64/gcc-4.9.2/py-matplotlib-2.0.0-vqmkcvk7carv6uwdb55rvd2uyxlliedf/lib/python2.7/site-packages/site.py", line 73, in <module>
    __boot()
  File "/wang/environment/software/jessie/spack/2017-01-26/opt/spack/linux-debian8-x86_64/gcc-4.9.2/py-matplotlib-2.0.0-vqmkcvk7carv6uwdb55rvd2uyxlliedf/lib/python2.7/site-packages/site.py", line 34, in __boot
    imp.load_module('site', stream, path, descr)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site.py", line 563, in <module>
    main()
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site.py", line 545, in main
    known_paths = addusersitepackages(known_paths)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site.py", line 272, in addusersitepackages
    user_site = getusersitepackages()
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site.py", line 247, in getusersitepackages
    user_base = getuserbase() # this will also set USER_BASE
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site.py", line 237, in getuserbase
    USER_BASE = get_config_var('userbase')
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/sysconfig.py", line 582, in get_config_var
    return get_config_vars().get(name)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/sysconfig.py", line 528, in get_config_vars
    _init_posix(_CONFIG_VARS)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/sysconfig.py", line 412, in _init_posix
    from _sysconfigdata import build_time_vars
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/_sysconfigdata.py", line 6, in <module>
    from _sysconfigdata_nd import *
ImportError: No module named _sysconfigdata_nd
```

however I don't know what this is trying to tell me or where I would start to fix this.

Can anyone reproduce this issue?
title: py-matplotlib use leads to Illeagal instruction failure
